item.title: Ideas
item.description: Here are some personal projects I am interested in working on, in no particular order: The Weirdest Things Analyze content tags for front-page news stories of major national newspapers to find the most unusual stories See how or if the subject matter has changed over a period of several years Sans Swagger Use a neural network to create a rap lyric generator Applications of agent-based modeling in financial portfolio analysis Segregation study Use US Census data to rate tracts according to levels of ethnic and racial diversity As well as incomes, noting in Portland MSA the possible impact of professional athletesâ€™ salaries on mean incomes of blacks.

item.title: The Best and Worst Neighborhoods in Portland
item.description: This analysis was done for an assignment in the GEOG488 GIS1 course at Portland State University. The geospatial data used in this project is both very large (about 1.6 GB) and not freely distributable. Therefore the resulting report it is presented as a pdf.

item.title: About
item.description: I am a Salesforce Administrator and Developer in Portland, Oregon. I like automating things so businesses can spend more time focusing on what really matters. I am also interested in basketball, cycling, literature, and space travel.

item.title: CV
item.description: Ian Davis ian@aloosefish.com Skills Certified Salesforce Administrator Adept user of declarative and non-declarative (Python, Apex, SQL) reporting and automation tools Experience supporting data-intensive applications for a global customer base Education Trailhead.Salesforce.com/me/ianthedavis 2019 Learned Salesforce Administration and Development by earning over 100 course completion badges. DataCamp.com/profile/aloosefish 2018 Learned how to analyze data and create reports using Python and R by completing 29 interactive courses. Integrated these skills into college coursework.

item.title: WR327_Example
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min.
